definition: to preserve the accomplishments of previous generations/to carry on the good work of one's predecessors
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: Shall we finish the job tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我們明天守成這件工作好嗎？

sentences.english: Why do we have to stick to conventions and dare not go one step beyond the prescribed limit?
sentences.chinese: 我們爲什麼要墨守成規，不敢越雷池一步呢？

sentences.english: He showed little initiative, handling all matters strictly by the book.
sentences.chinese: 他缺乏首創精神，墨守成規地辦一切事情。

sentences.english: You will never change their ideas. They are far too hidebound .
sentences.chinese: 你無法改變他們的意思，因爲他們太墨守成規。

sentences.english: Ted is a real stick- in- the- mud.
sentences.chinese: 特德真是個墨守成規的人。

definition: to preserve one's heritage/to defend the accomplishments of previous generations/to carry on the good work/to keep one's business going
to pioneer a frontier area/to open up new territory
to show initiative/to be a go-getter/to push forward with one's agenda
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
content to hold a small part of the territory/fig. forced to relinquish the middle ground/forced to move away
to get things done relying on others (idiom); with a little help from his friends
